Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF X 12
Descriptive title: Religious poetry
Contents note: 1. My heart yearns for the land of Jerusalem, my abode, may it please God to make it my homeland; 2. Lord, I am concerned with the marvels of George ...; 3. The second marvel of St. George ...; 4. The nature of the fast; 5. Praise God, O all peoples, praise God day and night; 6. O my eyes, do not weep for the dead ...; 7. Praise God, O all peoples, the Lord of Lords, the Omniscient; 8. I beheld the birth of the Virgin ....

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF X 30
Descriptive title: Sermons
Contents note: 1. Thirty-ninth sermon: We ought to build a home free of rot by taking up moral virtues; 2. Fortieth sermon: We ought not to extend our battles beyond our power for the sake of God; 3. Forty-second sermon: On concord and love; 4. Forty-third sermon: We ought to spend our days of holy fasting in rest and ease; 5. Forty-fourth sermon: On sudden departure from this worldly life; 6. Forty-fifth sermon: We ought not to surrender ourselves to adversity; 7. Forty-sixth sermon: We ought to imitate the suffering of the Lord; 8. Forty-seventh sermon: Report on the Christians killed in Bolghan for their refusal to eat meat during Lent; 9. Forty-eighth sermon: On the dominion of our Lord Jesus Christ and his incarnation; 10. Forty-ninth sermon: On the Annunciation to the Virgin Mary; 11. Fiftieth sermon: The Passover prefigures the future, eternal Passover in patience and courage; 12. Fifty-first sermon: On always celebrating and keeping the Passover for the sake of God; 13. Fifty-second sermon: We ought to be renewed after having received news of our coming trials, both perceptible and imperceptible; 14. Fifty-third sermon: We ought to endure any punishment in imitation of Christ and his holiness; 15. Fifty-fourth sermon: We ought to guard ourselves from the deception of Satan; 16. Fifty-fifth sermon: On righteous suffering and the lessons of humility and patience; 17. Fifty-sixth sermon: On the suffering of our Lord and Master Jesus Christ; 18. Fifty-seventh sermon: On the rebuke of brothers who have transgressed and a lesson and sermon on discipline.

Rights contact: To inquire about image rights, contact St. Catherine's Monastery, https://www.sinaimonastery.com, sinaimonastery@gmail.com.

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF X 34
Descriptive title: Varia
Contents note: 1. The story of our father Adam; 2. The story of the wisdom of the woman known as Sibyl whose son Heraclius was the pagan leader of Ephesus, and an interpretation of a dream that one hundred wise men had in Rome during the same night and hour, which was the departure of the Jewish people from Egypt; 3. Commentary of Mar Ephrem on ancient interpretations (the Testament of our father Adam to his son Seth); 4. Book of the teachings belonging to the Christian and Jewish men of the city of Homs; 5. Article beginning, "If you want to learn when the Christians fast and hold festival and the days in which the Jews hold festival ..."; 6. Sermon for those preparing for the communion of marriage and what is recited at the time of the wedding to the man and woman.

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF X 50
Descriptive title: Sermons
Contents note: 1. Tenth sermon: On death; 2. Eleventh sermon: On the spiritual harvest and the unceasing progeny of the servants of Christ, read during the harvest; 3. Twelfth sermon: On abstinence from ephemeral pleasures; 4. Thirteenth sermon: We ought to preserve the beauty of the unpolluted soul, read during Transfiguration and Repentance; 5. Fourteenth sermon: On death; 6. Fifteenth sermon: On the commemoration of St. John Archbishop of Chalcedon; 7. Sixteenth sermon: On the gift of God and his boundless love; 8. Eighteenth sermon: We ought not to give ourselves up to the sufferings of disgrace; 9. Nineteenth sermon: On spiritual cultivation; 10. Twentieth sermon: On fidelity; 11. Twenty-first sermon: On Christ's concern for us; 12. Twenty-second sermon: On eternal judgment; 13. Twenty-third sermon: On the birth of the Savior; 14. Twenty-fourth sermon: On the migration from this world; 15. Twenty-fifth sermon: On virginity.

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac NF M 9
Descriptive title: Memra on the Contest of Job ; Memre of Ephrem on Uriah the Hittite and David the King ; Memra of Isaac the Teacher on the Antichrist ; Memra of Jacob on the Antichrist’s Teaching ; Memra on Mar Daniel by Mar Ephrem
AltTitle.other: Memra of Mar Jacob on the Antichrist’s teaching while the Holy Apostles warred against him
Author: Ephrem the Syrian, Saint, 303-373|~|Jacob, of Serug, 451-521
Contents note: The Memra on the Antichrist and its attributed author Isaac the Teacher are otherwise unknown. Philothée, p. 293 attributes this work to Isaac of Amid.
Illustrations note: On f. 44v, under the rubric, there is drawn in red ink a waving line, like a serpent, the head of which ends in a cross. It appears opposite the words “O jealousy how bitter you are!”
Script note: Estrangelo script; regular and well aligned on both sides
